reporting-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

title.narrative: Conservation of tigers and tiger prey in Thailand’s Western Forest Complex through law enforcement and education

description.narrative: Conserve biodiversity and manage natural resources in ways that maintain their long-term viability and preserve their potential to meet the needs of present and future generations. Activities include combating illegal and corrupt exploitation of natural resources and the control of invasive species. Programs in this element should be integrated with the Agriculture Area under Economic Growth and Conflict Mitigation and Reconciliation Area under the Peace and Security Category, when applicable and appropriate.

This award strives to conserve biodiversity and manage natural resources in ways that maintain their long-term viability and preserve their potential to meet the needs of present and future generations. Activities include combating illegal and corrupt exploitation of natural resources and the control of invasive species. This includes The purpose of this project is to bring the population of tigers back to its natural carrying capacity in this World Heritage Site. This will be done by: (1) maintaining the Smart patrol system in TYW by (a) training park rangers, (b) replacing broken GPSs and digital cameras with new ones, (c) supporting ration costs and other important field supplies, (d) examining data collected for errors and quality and enter data into MIST database, (e) arranging monthly meetings with heads of the patrol teams and facilitate the meeting, (f) preparing monthly reports using MIST and make them useful for management improvement, (g) distributing the cost for patrol rations and providing other morale boosting supplies and materials for patrol teams, and (h) measuring progress using functions in MIST software to evaluate patrol efforts and effectiveness in reduction of threats; (2) publishing 1,000 copies of the 2-volume manual titled Nature Education for Conservation of Endangered Wildlife Species; (3) presenting a training workshop on the manuals for school teachers and a second workshop for local NGOs and government; and (4) setting up the International House of Conservation at Kasetsart University to initially work with about 60 students by establishing the following (a) necessary room renovations, (b) 10 stations of visual and sound labs (computer sets and head phones) for self-study of international conservation projects, (c) a small meeting room (10 seats) for small group teaching, seminar, and group discussion among the students, and (d) cabinets for DVDs of conservation and nature programs in WEFCOM and around the world, books, brochures, reports, and papers from international conservation projects including WEFCOM, and reading corners for self-learning..

participating-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

participating-org.usg:office-name: Fish and Wildlife Service/Office of International Affairs

owner-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

description.narrative: The United States is engaging Thailand primarily as a development partner to leverage its significant resources as an upper middle income country to encourage it to take a greater leadership role in addressing global and regional challenges of mutual concern. Throughout its modern history as a constitutional monarchy, Thailand has experienced years of political uncertainty, including, most recently, a military coup in May 2014 following six months of protests, the dissolution of parliament, and failed national elections. Such dramatic shifts in the political system are disruptive for a key U.S. ally and make clear that there is a continued need for engagement in priority areas with U.S. support for good governance and transnational rule of law. Many political, legal, and criminal justice institutions are still developing and will benefit from continued U.S. engagement. Achieving U.S. strategic goals in Thailand and in the region is predicated on the country's stability. U.S. assistance will promote peace and security, foster reforms and modernization of the criminal justice system, and strengthen good governance.

usg:treasury-account.usg:main-account: Multinational Species Conservation Fund, United States Fish and Wildlife Service
